question.name: Breadcrumbs
question.questiontext: The image below is an example of:
question.generalfeedback: Remember, this is the preferred way of navigating around Moodle.

question_hint.hint: Think of way to get back to where you started.

question.name: Going back to the course.
question.questiontext: If you were on the page "COURSE ROLES" and wanted to get back to the previous page, which link would you click?

question.name: 2 Ways of Navigating
question.questiontext: What are the two basic ways of navigating around Moodle? (Select both).

question.name: Which role do teachers who are implementing ATEP have?
question.questiontext: Which role do teachers who are implementing ATEP have?

question.name: Switching roles
question.questiontext: Can a teacher switch to see "what a student sees"?

answer.answertext: Yes. By using "Switch role to..." in the Administration block.

question.name: Which of the following is not a role within ATEP Moodle?
question.questiontext: Which of the following is NOT a role within ATEP Moodle?

question.name: Feasibility teacher limits.
question.questiontext: Which of the following are Feasibility teachers prevented from doing?

question.name: Non-editing teachers
question.questiontext: Which of the following can Non-editing teachers do?

answer.feedback: Yes. Non-editing teachers can help grade students.
Only Feasibility teachers, not non-editing teachers, can Show/Hide material from students.
Due to the nature of the program, neither Feasibility nor Non-editing teachers can do this.
Due to the nature of the program, neither Feasibility nor Non-editing teachers can do this.

question.name: What can Feasibility Teachers see in an ATEP Moodle course?
question.questiontext: What can Feasibility Teachers see in an ATEP Moodle course?

question.name: What can students see in an ATEP Moodle course?
question.questiontext: What can students see in an ATEP Moodle course?

question.name: Feasibility Teachers limited in what they see in Moodle.
question.questiontext: The Feasibility Teacher role is limited in what they see in Moodle.

question.name: In order to control whether something is shown or hidden, what is the first ...
question.questiontext: In order to control whether something is shown or hidden, what is the first thing that a Feasibility Teacher must do?

question.name: An open eye means...
question.questiontext: An open eye means...

answer.answertext: students can NOT see that item

question.name: A closed eye means...
question.questiontext: A closed eye means...

answer.answertext: students can NOT see that item

question.name: In ATEP, it is very important to view the content ahead of time. This will ...
question.questiontext: In ATEP, it is very important to view the content ahead of time. This will provide the teacher with the knowledge of what content is covered and what pre-teaching may be necessary.

question.name: The student view and the teacher view in the Lesson activity are exactly the ...
question.questiontext: The student view and the teacher view in the Lesson activity are exactly the same.

question.name: The Lesson activity module can include quiz questions. One easy way to ...
question.questiontext: The Lesson activity module can include quiz questions. One easy way to preview the questions is to use the Edit tab and which of the following sub-tabs?

question.name: One report that can be very powerful in the Lesson activity module is the ...
question.questiontext: One report that can be very powerful in the Lesson activity module is the Overview Report. This will report how long each student spent on a Lesson activity. What can it mean if the student spent very little time on the Lesson assignment?

answer.answertext: student was carefully considering each word

question.name: If there are essays present in a Lesson activity, they be graded directly ...
question.questiontext: If there are essays present in a Lesson activity, they be graded directly through the Lesson activity.

question.name: Essays in the Lesson activity module can be graded through the gradebook.
question.questiontext: Essays in the Lesson activity module can be graded through the gradebook.

question.name: The Assignment activity icon look like a hand holding a piece of paper.
question.questiontext: The Assignment activity icon look like a hand holding a piece of paper.

question.name: The Assignment activity allows students to write papers or turn in documents ...
question.questiontext: The Assignment activity allows students to write papers or turn in documents to the teacher by attaching them within Moodle.

question.name: There are two ways for a student to turn in an attachment via the Assignment ...
question.questiontext: There are two ways for a student to turn in an attachment via the Assignment module.

question.name: Once students submit an assignment, they may be able to change it and ...
question.questiontext: Once students submit an assignment, they may be able to change it and resubmit until the Feasibility Teacher does this to the assignment.

question.name: Using the LAE Grader, grades may be entering manually providing that...
question.questiontext: Using the LAE Grader, grades may be entering manually providing that...

answer.answertext: Turn editing on has been clicked
all assignments have been turned in
the assignments are hidden from students

question.name: In ATEP, what are folders mostly used for?
question.questiontext: In ATEP, what are folders mostly used for?

question.name: Quizzes that are all multiple choice or True/False will be automatically ...
question.questiontext: Quizzes that are all multiple choice or True/False will be automatically graded and entered into the gradebook within Moodle.

question.name: Feasibility Teachers have the ability to see each quiz question and the ...
question.questiontext: Feasibility Teachers have the ability to see each quiz question and the correct answer.

question.name: Essays in Moodle need to be graded how?
question.questiontext: Essays in Moodle need to be graded how?

question.name: The Glossary module provides students with definitions to important words.
question.questiontext: The Glossary module provides students with definitions to important words.

question.name: The Glossary module can only be used to provide definitions by clicking on ...
question.questiontext: The Glossary module can only be used to provide definitions by clicking on the correct Glossary.
